poem:
**A Turn of Fate**

In Seoul, the echoes  
of caged whispers linger,  
a courthouse symphony  
of justice's decree.  
She, the shadow of power,  
now casts a new silhouette.  
History marks them both  
in the dance of bars—  
a first in the annals,  
red threads untangled  
in the morning light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "South Korean court orders arrest of impeached former president’s wife A South Korean court on Tuesday ordered the arrest of Kim Keon Hee, the wife of the impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol, making her the first former first lady to be arrested in the country’s history. The Seoul central district court ruling creates an unprecedented situation in which both members of a former presidential couple are simultaneously in custody. Yoon Suk Yeol was sent". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: South Korean court orders arrest of impeached former president’s wife A South Korean court on Tuesday ordered the arrest of Kim Keon Hee, the wife of the impeached former president Yoon Suk Yeol, making her the first former first lady to be arrested in the country’s history. The Seoul central district court ruling creates an unprecedented situation in which both members of a former presidential couple are simultaneously in custody. Yoon Suk Yeol was sent
